overview: From 2026-02-07 to 2026-02-08, elizaos-plugins/registry had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: add @proofgate/eliza-plugin for AI agent transaction guardrails
topPRs.author: 0xKairo
topPRs.body:
## Plugin: @proofgate/eliza-plugin **Repository:** https://github.com/ProofGate/proofgate-eliza-plugin **NPM:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/@proofgate/eliza-plugin **Website:** https://www.proofgate.xyz ### Description ProofGate provides blockchain transaction guardrails for AI agents: - Validate transactions before execution - Auto-block unsafe transactions (infinite approvals, drainer contracts, etc.) - On-chain cryptographic proofs on Base mainnet - 19 EVM chains supported - Custom guardrail policies ### Actions - `PROOFGATE_VALIDATE_TRANSACTION` - Full validation with detailed response - `PROOFGATE_CHECK_SAFETY` - Quick boolean safety check - `PROOFGATE_GET_EVIDENCE` - Retrieve on-chain proof ### Installation ```bash npm install @proofgate/eliza-plugin ``` ### Configuration Requires `PROOFGATE_API_KEY` environment variable. --- This PR only modifies `index.json` as per contribution guidelines. ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Release Notes * **Chores** * Added a new plugin mapping to the registry, making the ProofGate Eliza plugin publicly available for integration.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the ProofGate Eliza plugin to the registry, which provides blockchain transaction guardrails for AI agents. **Changes:** - Added `@proofgate/eliza-plugin` entry to `index.json` pointing to `github:ProofGate/proofgate-eliza-plugin` - Entry follows the correct format with package name as key and GitHub repository reference as value - Entry uses standard 3-space indentation consistent with the rest of the file - Entry is placed in alphabetical order between `@pyboom/plugin-moralis-v2` and `@token-metrics-ai/plugin-tokenmetrics` - No other files modified, as required by contribution guidelines **Plugin Purpose:** ProofGate provides transaction validation, auto-blocking of unsafe transactions (infinite approvals, drainer contracts), on-chain cryptographic proofs on Base mainnet, and supports 19 EVM chains with custom guardrail policies.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The PR makes a single, well-structured addition to the registry following all contribution guidelines. Only `index.json` is modified, the entry follows the correct format (package name to GitHub reference), uses proper indentation, and maintains alphabetical ordering. The change is minimal, focused, and exactly matches the expected pattern for registry additions. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `@proofgate/eliza-plugin` entry following the correct format; minor indentation inconsistency with surrounding entries |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant CI as GitHub Actions participant Generated as generated-registry.json participant Users as ElizaOS Users Dev->>PR: Submit PR adding @proofgate/eliza-plugin entry PR->>Registry: Modify index.json with new plugin entry Note over Registry: Entry format:
"@proofgate/eliza-plugin": "github:ProofGate/proofgate-eliza-plugin" PR->>CI: Trigger automated review workflow CI->>Registry: Validate JSON format CI->>Registry: Verify only index.json modified CI->>PR: Review and approve changes PR->>Registry: Merge to main branch Registry->>CI: Trigger registry generation CI->>Generated: Process plugin metadata CI->>Generated: Fetch version info from GitHub CI->>Generated: Update generated-registry.json Generated->>Users: Plugin available in CLI and web registry ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: Add Arthur DEX plugin (Orderly Network perp trading)
topPRs.author: arthur-orderly
topPRs.body:
## Arthur DEX Plugin Adds the Arthur DEX plugin for trading perpetuals on Orderly Network. - **Package:** `@arthur-orderly/plugin-arthur-dex` - **Repository:** [arthur-orderly/arthur-eliza-plugin](https://github.com/arthur-orderly/arthur-eliza-plugin) - **Features:** Place market/limit orders, manage positions, check balances on Orderly Network perp DEX - **Website:** [arthur-dex-puce.vercel.app](https://arthur-dex-puce.vercel.app) ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * A new plugin integration has been added to the available options.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

Adds the Arthur DEX plugin (`@arthur-orderly/plugin-arthur-dex`) to the elizaOS plugin registry for trading perpetuals on Orderly Network. **Key Changes:** - New plugin entry added to `index.json` with proper format: `"@arthur-orderly/plugin-arthur-dex":"github:arthur-orderly/arthur-eliza-plugin"` - Entry is correctly placed alphabetically (before `@bealers/plugin-mattermost`) - Follows all registry formatting requirements (uses `github:` prefix, no `.git` extension, proper JSON syntax) - Note: A separate Orderly Network plugin already exists at `@elizaos/plugin-orderly` maintained by `orderlynetwork` **Validation:** - JSON format is valid with proper comma placement - GitHub repository reference follows the required `github:org/repo` format - Alphabetical ordering is maintained - No modifications to other files (PR only touches `index.json` as required)

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The PR makes a single, straightforward change to add a new plugin entry to the registry. The entry follows all formatting requirements: correct JSON syntax, proper alphabetical ordering, uses the `github:` prefix without `.git` extension, and only modifies `index.json` as required. The format matches existing entries and will be processed correctly by the automated registry generation workflow. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Adds `@arthur-orderly/plugin-arthur-dex` entry for Arthur DEX plugin with correct format, alphabetical ordering, and valid JSON syntax |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant GHA as GitHub Actions participant GenReg as generated-registry.json participant Users as elizaOS Users Dev->>PR: Submit PR with new plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add @arthur-orderly/plugin-arthur-dex Note over Registry: Entry added alphabetically
with proper format PR->>GHA: Trigger on merge to main GHA->>Registry: Read updated index.json GHA->>GHA: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>GHA: Process version & compatibility info GHA->>GenReg: Generate/update registry GenReg->>Users: Plugin available in CLI/web registry Users->>Users: Install via package.json or CLI ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
